steps.title: Open Google Photos.
steps.content: Open Google Photos. This app icon looks like a red, blue, green, and yellow pinwheel that you can find on your Home screens, in the app drawer, or by searching. If you don't have Google Photos, you can download it for free from either the Google Play Store or App Store.

steps.title: Tap a photo you want to order.
steps.content: Tap a photo you want to order. If you want to order prints of multiple photos, tap and hold a picture and tap other pictures to add a checkmark in the corner.

steps.title: Tap ⋮ or the shopping cart icon.
steps.content: Tap ⋮ or the shopping cart icon. If you tapped on one picture, you'll see the three-dot menu icon in the upper right corner of the screen. If you tapped for multiple pictures, you'll see the shopping cart icon in the top right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the shopping cart icon that says Order Photo (if you selected a single photo only).
steps.content: Tap the shopping cart icon that says Order Photo (if you selected a single photo only). If you selected more than one picture in the previous steps, skip this step.

steps.title: Tap Photo print.
steps.content: Tap Photo print . You'll see this with "Photo book" and "Canvas print." A Photo print is a single, 4x6 printout of your photo, a photo book is a book (soft or hard covered) with 20+ pages, and a canvas print is a large print out of your photo. Photo prints are only available in the US.

steps.title: Preview your photo order.
steps.content: Preview your photo order. You have the opportunity to make light edits to your pictures, add more pictures to the order, or remove any before placing the order.

steps.title: Tap Next.
steps.content: Tap Next . You'll see this button under the preview space.

steps.title: Select a store to pick up from.
steps.content: Select a store to pick up from. You have the opportunity to change which stores you can use to print out your photo. Prints at CVS will have a glossy finish and prints at Walmart will have a matte finish. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Select Location.
steps.content: Tap Select Location . You'll see this button appear once you've selected a location under the location's information, such as when your prints will be ready to pick up and the store hours.

steps.title: Tap Place Order.
steps.content: Tap Place Order . You'll see this under the cost of your image, the pickup location, and the pickup name. Orders can not be canceled once they are placed.

steps.title: Go to https://photos.google.com/.
steps.content: Go to https://photos.google.com/ . You can use any browser to access your Google Photos. Log in if prompted.

steps.title: Click ☰.
steps.content: Click ☰ . You'll see this at the top left of the browser window.

steps.title: Click the shopping cart icon next to Print Store.
steps.content: Click the shopping cart icon next to Print Store . This is usually in the first grouping of options, near the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Click Photo prints.
steps.content: Click Photo prints . You'll see this under the header image with "Photo books" and "Canvas prints." Photo prints are only available in the US.

steps.title: Click + Order photo prints.
steps.content: Click + Order photo prints . You can also choose from the pre-selected albums which photos to print.

steps.title: Click to select the photos you want to print.
steps.content: Click to select the photos you want to print. You can select 1-200 pictures to print. A blue checkmark in the corner of a picture indicates that it is selected.

steps.title: Click Done.
steps.content: Click Done . You'll see this in the upper right corner of the browser window.

steps.title: Preview your photo order.
steps.content: Preview your photo order. You have the opportunity to make light edits to your pictures, add more pictures to the order, or remove any before placing the order.

steps.title: Tap Next.
steps.content: Tap Next . You'll see this button in the top right corner of the browser window.

steps.title: Select a store to pick up from.
steps.content: Select a store to pick up from. You have the opportunity to change which stores you can use to print out your photo. Prints at CVS will have a glossy finish and prints at Walmart will have a matte finish. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Select Location.
steps.content: Tap Select Location . You'll see this button appear once you've selected a location under the location's information, such as when your prints will be ready to pick up and the store hours.

steps.title: Tap Place Order.
steps.content: Tap Place Order . You'll see this under the cost of your image, the pickup location, and the pickup name. Orders can not be canceled once they are placed.

steps.title: Go to https://photos.google.com/.
steps.content: Go to https://photos.google.com/ . You can use any browser to access your Google Photos and download your pictures to print later. Log in if prompted.

steps.title: Navigate to the picture you want to download and print.
steps.content: Navigate to the picture you want to download and print. You can go through your Photos feed or albums to select a photo. You can click a photo's checkmark in the top left corner to select multiple.

steps.title: Press ⇧ Shift+D to download the selected image/s.
steps.content: Press ⇧ Shift + D to download the selected image/s. You can also click ⋮ > Download.

steps.title: Open and print the downloaded file.
steps.content: Open and print the downloaded file. Depending on your default image-viewing software, your image will open in a printable format and have the Print option under the File tab.
